author: @CTVNorthernNews
title: North Bay news: Nelson thanks Battalion fans, city for support during Sweden World Juniors | CTV News
text: [Skip to main content](#main) Nelson thanks North Bay fans, city for support during World Juniors Team Canada defenceman [Ty Nelson](https://northernontario.ctvnews.ca/north-bay-battalion-defenceman-called-to-sweden-to-compete-in-the-world-junior-championship-1.6700645) is taking time out of his busy [World Junior Hockey Championship](https://www.iihf.com/en/events/2024/wm20) schedule to thank fans back home who are cheering him on. North Bay Battalion blueliner Ty Nelson received a late call-up by Hockey Canada on Saturday to compete in the World Junior Hockey Championship in Sweden. (Photo courtesy of Hockey Canada)Nelson picked up two assists in Wednesday‚Äôs [10-0 rout of Latvia](https://northernontario.ctvnews.ca/macklin-celebrini-s-five-point-performance-leads-canada-over-latvia-at-world-juniors-1.6702559). Canada also picked up a [5-2 Boxing Day win](https://northernontario.ctvnews.ca/canada-downs-finland-5-2-in-world-junior-opener-1.6701308) on the opening day of the tournament. Nelson was a late addition to the Canadian roster after initially being cut at the [pre-tournament selection camp](https://northernontario.ctvnews.ca/two-north-bay-battalion-players-aim-to-crack-canada-s-world-juniors-lineup-1.6676621). During an interview with TSN‚Äôs [Mark Masters](https://www.tsn.ca/talent/mark-masters-1.57261) Thursday, Nelson smiled when he heard about all of the support he has been getting from Battalion fans, and the city as a whole, back home. A handful of [Battalion fans gathered at Memorial Gardens](https://northernontario.ctvnews.ca/north-bay-hockey-fans-cheering-for-ty-nelson-at-world-juniors-1.6702369) to cheer both the team and their blue liner before the game started against Latvia. ‚ÄúIf it wasn‚Äôt for North Bay, I wouldn‚Äôt be where I am today,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm super grateful for them and I just love the community and the city.‚Äù A handful of fans gathered outside of Memorial Gardens in North Bay on Wednesday before Team Canada's game against Latvia to cheer on Battalion defenceman Ty Nelson. (Eric Taschner/CTV News Northern Ontario) - [Want more local news? Check out the North Bay page](http://northernontario.ctvnews.ca/north-bay) - [Daily newsletter with the top local stories emailed to your inbox](http://www.ctvnews.ca/newsletters) It was a whirlwind few days for Nelson when he received the call he would be joining the team after injuries and illness rocked the team‚Äôs defence core. He was in Pittsburgh, Penn. to watch the Penguins play and was on his way to catch the Steelers game as part of a family vacation when [Hockey Canada](https://www.hockeycanada.ca/en-ca/home) called him. ‚ÄúI got the news about 10, 15 minutes before I was about to walk out the door for the Steelers game," the North Bay Battalion defenceman said. "Packed up the car and was on the road to Toronto within 20, 30 minutes." Nelson boarded a flight in Toronto at 4 p.m. on Sunday. He landed in Gothenburg a little after 3 p.m. on Monday. He would have arrived sooner, but his connecting flight was delayed. "We were flying into Gothenburg and the winds were too heavy," he said. "We landed, but then had to go right back into the air. It was a pretty scary day, not going to lie. Then we were in Stockholm for about an hour and a half. Luckily, we were able to land in Gothenburg when we flew back. It was about a 45-minute flight so not too bad." Nelson played a little over seven minutes against Finland but didn‚Äôt record a point. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs nothing more grateful than playing at Mem. (Memorial) Gardens with the fans behind me and it‚Äôs now amazing to have them behind me here,‚Äù Nelson said. Team Canada has the day off on Thursday at the tournament. The next game will be a tough test for the Canadians facing off against host country Sweden on Friday at 1:30 p.m. EST. The game is on [TSN](https://www.tsn.ca/). [Shopping Trends](https://www.ctvnews.ca/shopping.html) The Shopping Trends team is independent of the journalists at CTV News. We may earn a commission when you use our links to shop. [Read about us.](https://www.ctvnews.ca/shopping/about-us.html) [Top Stories](https://barrie.ctvnews.ca/) - - - - - - - BREAKING BREAKING [Ten people rescued from plane crash site in remote N.W.T.](https://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/ten-people-rescued-from-plane-crash-site-in-remote-n-w-t-1.6703206) - CTVNews.ca Top Stories BREAKING [Ten people rescued from plane crash site in remote N.W.T.](https://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/ten-people-rescued-from-plane-crash-site-in-remote-n-w-t-1.6703206) The military says a rescue operation is complete after a plane crash left 10 people, some with injuries, stranded overnight in a remote area of the Northwest Territories. [NDP's Jagmeet Singh rules out coalition government with Liberals after next election](https://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/ndp-s-jagmeet-singh-rules-out-coalition-government-with-liberals-after-next-election-1.6703348) NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh is ruling out the possibility of forming a coalition government with the Liberals if no party wins a clear majority after the next federal election. [Judih Weinstein Haggai, the last Canadian known to have been kidnapped by Hamas, confirmed dead](https://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/judih-weinstein-haggai-the-last-canadian-known-to-have-been-kidnapped-by-hamas-confirmed-dead-1.6703209) Judih Weinstein Haggai, the only Canadian citizen who was still missing amid the Israel-Hamas conflict and believed to be held in the Gaza Strip, has been reported dead. [In most African countries, drought forces rural communities to relocate, study finds](https://www.ctvnews.ca/climate-and-environment/in-most-african-countries-drought-forces-rural-communities-to-relocate-study-finds-1.6703720) Across most of Africa, drought is driving people who live in rural settlements closer to rivers and cities, according to a new study published in the journal Earth's Future. [Teen dead, another missing after falling through ice in Ottawa amid spate of similar incidents across Canada](https://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/teen-dead-another-missing-after-falling-through-ice-in-ottawa-amid-spate-of-similar-incidents-across-canada-1.6703498) A teenager is dead and another is still missing after four youths fell through the ice on the Rideau River in Ottawa's south end late Wednesday. [Pierce Brosnan is in hot water, accused of trespassing in a Yellowstone thermal area](https://www.ctvnews.ca/entertainment/pierce-brosnan-is-in-hot-water-accused-of-trespassing-in-a-yellowstone-thermal-area-1.6703402) Pierce Brosnan, whose fictitious movie character James Bond has been in hot water plenty of times, is now facing heat in real life, charged with stepping out of bounds in a thermal area during a recent visit to Yellowstone National Park. [Ontario man charged after allegedly planning trip to U.S. for sex acts with kids](https://toronto.ctvnews.ca/ontario-man-charged-after-allegedly-planning-trip-to-u-s-for-sex-acts-with-kids-1.6703437) Durham police say they arrested a man Thursday after learning that he allegedly planned to travel to the United States in order to engage in sex acts with a woman and her young children. [Tight-knit Canada set for tough test against hosts Sweden at world juniors](https://www.ctvnews.ca/sports/tight-knit-canada-set-for-tough-test-against-hosts-sweden-at-world-juniors-1.6703713) Canada will march into the jam-packed Scandinavium arena -- a building that resembles Calgary's Scotiabank Saddledome -- against the tournament hosts Friday night in a marquee Group A matchup. "Skilled, dangerous," Canadian head coach Alan Letang said of Sweden. "Very, very dangerous off the rush." [Canada to offer humanitarian visas to those fleeing Sudan if relatives pay costs](https://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/canada-to-offer-humanitarian-visas-to-those-fleeing-sudan-if-relatives-pay-costs-1.6703632) Ottawa is offering a lifeline to people fleeing an escalating civil war in Sudan if they have relatives in Canada who agree to financially support them. [Barrie](https://barrie.ctvnews.ca/) - [Driver suffers life-altering injuries in Bracebridge crash](https://barrie.ctvnews.ca/driver-suffers-life-altering-injuries-in-bracebridge-crash-1.6703604) Provincial police are investigating a single-vehicle collision in Bracebridge that sent one person to a Toronto area hospital. - [Innisfil driver accused of being impaired after crashing into house on Christmas Day](https://barrie.ctvnews.ca/innisfil-driver-accused-of-being-impaired-after-crashing-into-house-on-christmas-day-1.6703431) An Innisfil resident faces charges after crashing into a house on Christmas Day. - [Business owners and family grappling with devastating loss after deadly fire](https://barrie.ctvnews.ca/business-owners-and-family-grappling-with-devastating-loss-after-deadly-fire-1.6702427) A fire that started from a parked vehicle spread to the home of Barrie Paintball and is estimated to have caused $700,000 in damage between the building and its contents, and claimed the life of two pets. [Toronto](https://toronto.ctvnews.ca/) - [Woman allegedly intentionally drove vehicle into parking enforcement officer in Toronto](https://toronto.ctvnews.ca/woman-allegedly-intentionally-drove-vehicle-into-parking-enforcement-officer-in-toronto-1.6703595) Police arrested a 29-year-old woman after she allegedly intentionally drove her vehicle into a parking enforcement officer in Toronto‚Äôs east end. - [Citizen's tip helps police apprehend suspect wanted in Richmond Hill axe attack](https://toronto.ctvnews.ca/citizen-s-tip-helps-police-apprehend-suspect-wanted-in-richmond-hill-axe-attack-1.6703639) Police in York Region say media coverage, along with a tip from a member of the public, helped them apprehend a suspect wanted in connection with an axe attack in Richmond Hill as well as several other criminal offences. - [Ontario man charged after allegedly planning trip to U.S. for sex acts with kids](https://toronto.ctvnews.ca/ontario-man-charged-after-allegedly-planning-trip-to-u-s-for-sex-acts-with-kids-1.6703437) Durham police say they arrested a man Thursday after learning that he allegedly planned to travel to the United States in order to engage in sex acts with a woman and her young children. [Ottawa](https://ottawa.ctvnews.ca/) - [17-year-old dead, one missing after teens fall through the ice on the Rideau River in Ottawa](https://ottawa.ctvnews.ca/17-year-old-dead-one-missing-after-teens-fall-through-the-ice-on-the-rideau-river-in-ottawa-1.6702946) Ottawa police say one youth is dead and one person is missing after they fell through the ice on the Rideau River in Ottawa's south end on Wednesday. Two other teens were treated for mild hypothermia. - [Arnprior Aerospace to close after 70 years in operation](https://ottawa.ctvnews.ca/arnprior-aerospace-to-close-after-70-years-in-operation-1.6703770) The company opened in Arnprior in 1954 as a Boeing operation and will be closing its doors on March 6, 2024. - [Police searching for federal offender known to frequent Ottawa-Gatineau](https://ottawa.ctvnews.ca/police-searching-for-federal-offender-known-to-frequent-ottawa-gatineau-1.6703651) Ontario Provincial Police is seeking the public's assistance in locating a federal offender wanted on a Canada-wide warrant as a result of a breach of his statutory release. [Kitchener](https://kitchener.ctvnews.ca/) - [No one hurt after fire at Kitchener restaurants](https://kitchener.ctvnews.ca/no-one-hurt-after-fire-at-kitchener-restaurants-1.6703580) No one was hurt after flames broke out at a building containing two restaurants in Kitchener. - [Men arrested with $1,000 in stolen butter](https://kitchener.ctvnews.ca/men-arrested-with-1-000-in-stolen-butter-1.6703164) Three men from Brampton, Ont. were arrested on Christmas Eve in Guelph after police caught them with more than $1,000 in stolen butter. - [Man seriously injured in Waterloo stabbing](https://kitchener.ctvnews.ca/man-seriously-injured-in-waterloo-stabbing-1.6703244) Police are looking for the person or people responsible for a stabbing in Waterloo that seriously injured a 41-year-old man. [London](https://london.ctvnews.ca/) - [Conversation with Mayor Morgan Part 1: Homelessness, communication, and housing](https://london.ctvnews.ca/conversation-with-mayor-morgan-part-1-homelessness-communication-and-housing-1.6703743) In a year-end interview with CTV News, London Mayor Josh Morgan opens up about his greatest challenge of 2023. - ['Could hear the windows buckling': St. Thomas, Ont. tenants evacuated after apartment collapsed](https://london.ctvnews.ca/could-hear-the-windows-buckling-st-thomas-ont-tenants-evacuated-after-apartment-collapsed-1.6703460) Fifteen people are out of their homes after the foundation of small apartment building collapsed late Wednesday night in St. Thomas, Ont. - [Injured snowy owl rescued in Huron County](https://london.ctvnews.ca/injured-snowy-owl-rescued-in-huron-county-1.6703701) Huron County OPP responded to a report of an injured owl in Bayfield on Dec. 28. [Windsor](https://windsor.ctvnews.ca/) - [Pool contractor charged with fraud](https://windsor.ctvnews.ca/pool-contractor-charged-with-fraud-1.6703644) Windsor police have charged the owner of a pool installation company with fraud. - [What‚Äôs open and closed New Year's weekend in Windsor](https://windsor.ctvnews.ca/what-s-open-and-closed-new-year-s-weekend-in-windsor-1.6703429) As Windsor residents get ready to ring in the new year, there are a few closures to keep in mind this holiday weekend. - [Walpole Island man facing multiple charges](https://windsor.ctvnews.ca/walpole-island-man-facing-multiple-charges-1.6703290) Chatham-Kent police have charged a 36-year-old Walpole Island man with drug and weapon offences after a well-being check in a motel parking lot. [Montreal](https://montreal.ctvnews.ca/) - [Common Front of public sector unions reaches tentative deal with Quebec](https://montreal.ctvnews.ca/common-front-of-public-sector-unions-reaches-tentative-deal-with-quebec-1.6703590) The Common Front of unions representing around 420,000 public sector workers in Quebec has reached a proposed agreement in principle with the government. - [Montreal man who ate recalled cantaloupes launches class-action lawsuit](https://montreal.ctvnews.ca/montreal-man-who-ate-recalled-cantaloupes-launches-class-action-lawsuit-1.6702862) A Montreal man who says he was hospitalized with salmonella poisoning after eating recalled cantaloupes has launched a proposed class-action lawsuit against two companies that produced and distributed the fruit. - [Beaconsfield lawsuit against City of Montreal over taxes grows to $15 million](https://montreal.ctvnews.ca/beaconsfield-lawsuit-against-city-of-montreal-over-taxes-grows-to-15-million-1.6703689) The City of Beaconsfield is taking the City of Montreal to court because it feels it is being overtaxed by the centre city. [Atlantic](https://atlantic.ctvnews.ca/) - [Freezing rain warnings, special weather statements in effect in N.S., N.B.](https://atlantic.ctvnews.ca/freezing-rain-warnings-special-weather-statements-in-effect-in-n-s-n-b-1.6703142) More messy weather is on the way to the Maritimes with freezing rain warnings and special weather statements in effect. - ['I will not go out back': Moncton landlord worried about tenant safety](https://atlantic.ctvnews.ca/i-will-not-go-out-back-moncton-landlord-worried-about-tenant-safety-1.6703716) Peter LeBlanc needs to find a new tenant for his downtown Moncton apartment building. The landlord said the vacancy is the result of a current tenant no longer feeling like it‚Äôs safe place to live. - ['It‚Äôs been rough': Bedford resident looks for help following summer flooding](https://atlantic.ctvnews.ca/more/it-s-been-rough-bedford-resident-looks-for-help-following-summer-flooding-1.6703767) Marguerite Dodge‚Äôs Bedford, N.S., home has been uninhabitable since the summer floods hit back in late July. [Winnipeg](https://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/) - [Public asked to avoid Furby Street due to 'serious incident'](https://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/public-asked-to-avoid-furby-street-due-to-serious-incident-1.6703781) The Winnipeg Police Service is currently responding to a serious incident at an apartment building on Furby Street. - ['Take our time': Kinew says decision not made yet on supervised consumption site location](https://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/take-our-time-kinew-says-decision-not-made-yet-on-supervised-consumption-site-location-1.6703388) Manitoba Premier Wab Kinew said the province is taking its time to find a location for a supervised consumption site in Winnipeg. - [Winnipeg woman wins $1M lottery jackpot](https://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/winnipeg-woman-wins-1m-lottery-jackpot-1.6703271) A Winnipeg woman has a lot to celebrate heading into the new year after winning a $1 million lottery prize. [Calgary](https://calgary.ctvnews.ca/) - [Southern Alberta girl injured in coyote attack](https://calgary.ctvnews.ca/southern-alberta-girl-injured-in-coyote-attack-1.6703487) A family from Brooks, Alta., says their daughter is lucky to have avoided more serious injuries after she was attacked and bitten several times by a coyote. - [2 teens killed in rollover crash near Crossfield, Alta.](https://calgary.ctvnews.ca/2-teens-killed-in-rollover-crash-near-crossfield-alta-1.6703303) Two teens are dead following a crash in Mountain View County on Wednesday evening, RCMP said. - [Child-care costs could rise for some Alberta parents as daycares consider leaving fee support program](https://calgary.ctvnews.ca/child-care-costs-could-rise-for-some-alberta-parents-as-daycares-consider-leaving-fee-support-program-1.6703754) Some daycare operators in the province are considering opting out of the Alberta Affordability Grant for child-care programs, which is concerning to parents who could see their payments skyrocket in the new year as a result. [Edmonton](https://edmonton.ctvnews.ca/) - [Deaths of two officers 'haunt' Edmonton police chief](https://edmonton.ctvnews.ca/deaths-of-two-officers-haunt-edmonton-police-chief-1.6703587) Edmonton's police chief says the "line of duty" deaths of two officers in 2023 will stay with him and others forever. - [Closure of 8 'high-risk' encampments to begin Friday: city](https://edmonton.ctvnews.ca/closure-of-8-high-risk-encampments-to-begin-friday-city-1.6703512) Notice has been given to clear several high-risk encampments in Edmonton that were the subject of an injunction earlier this month. - [Man who died with wife and son in Alberta lake wasn't a risk-taker, says friend](https://edmonton.ctvnews.ca/man-who-died-with-wife-and-son-in-alberta-lake-wasn-t-a-risk-taker-says-friend-1.6703579) An Edmonton man who died with his wife and eight-year-old son after their utility terrain vehicle went into a lake wasn't the kind of person to put his family at risk, says a friend. [Vancouver](https://bc.ctvnews.ca/) - [Overpass strike in Delta closes Highway 99 southbound](https://bc.ctvnews.ca/overpass-strike-in-delta-closes-highway-99-southbound-1.6703708) A truck collided with an overpass in Delta Thursday, prompting road closures and a heavy presence of first responders. - [Convicted murderer wanted Canada-wide after breaching conditions: police](https://bc.ctvnews.ca/convicted-murderer-wanted-canada-wide-after-breaching-conditions-police-1.6703646) Police in Victoria are asking the public to call 911 if they encounter a man who is wanted on a Canada-wide warrant for breaching conditions of his parole. - ['Damage consistent with bullet holes': Surrey RCMP investigating shots fired at residence](https://bc.ctvnews.ca/damage-consistent-with-bullet-holes-surrey-rcmp-investigating-shots-fired-at-residence-1.6703760) Mounties in Surrey are investigating a report of shots fired at a residence Wednesday morning.

author: Fl√°via Said
title: IBGE: taxa de desemprego cai a 7,5% no trimestre, a menor desde 2015
text: IBGE: taxa de desemprego cai a 7,5% no trimestre, a menor desde 2015 Dados da Pnad Cont√≠nua sobre desemprego para trimestre m√≥vel encerrado em novembro de 2023 foram divulgados nesta sexta (29/12) pelo IBGE atualizado Compartilhar not√≠cia A taxa de desemprego no Brasil foi de 7,5% no trimestre m√≥vel terminado em novembro, segundo a [Pesquisa Nacional por Amostra de Domic√≠lios (Pnad Cont√≠nua)](https://agenciadenoticias.ibge.gov.br/agencia-noticias/2012-agencia-de-noticias/noticias/38700-de-2019-para-2022-trabalho-infantil-aumentou-no-pais), divulgada nesta sexta-feira (29/12) pelo [Instituto Brasileiro de Geografia e Estat√≠stica (IBGE)](https://www.ibge.gov.br/). O resultado, chamado pelo IBGE de taxa de desocupa√ß√£o, caiu 0,2 ponto percentual (p.p.) frente ao trimestre imediatamente anterior, de junho a agosto de 2023 (quando foi de 7,8%), e tamb√©m caiu 0,5 p.p. ante o mesmo trimestre m√≥vel de 2022 (8,1%). Foi a menor taxa de desocupa√ß√£o desde o trimestre encerrado em fevereiro de 2015, tamb√©m de 7,5%. A popula√ß√£o desocupada ficou em 8,2 milh√µes, um recuo de 6,2% (menos 539 mil pessoas) no ano. Foi o menor contingente de desocupados desde o trimestre m√≥vel encerrado em abril de 2015 (8,15 milh√µes). J√° a popula√ß√£o ocupada, de 100,5 milh√µes, √© o novo recorde da s√©rie hist√≥rica e cresceu 0,8% (mais 815 mil pessoas) no ano. O n√≠vel da ocupa√ß√£o (percentual de pessoas ocupadas na popula√ß√£o em idade de trabalhar) foi a 57,4%. Diferen√ßa do desemprego em rela√ß√£o ao Caged Diferentemente do Cadastro Geral de Empregados e Desempregados (Caged), divulgado pelo Minist√©rio do Trabalho e Emprego, que considera apenas os trabalhadores com carteira assinada, a pesquisa do IBGE mede a taxa de desemprego entre todos os trabalhadores na economia, incluindo o mercado informal. Na quinta-feira (28/12), foram divulgados os dados do Caged referentes a novembro. [O Brasil criou 130.097 empregos com carteira assinada no per√≠odo](https://www.metropoles.com/negocios/brasil-cria-130-mil-empregos-formais-mas-ritmo-do-avanco-diminui). O resultado √© a terceira redu√ß√£o seguida do ritmo de crescimento, embora o indicador tenha se mantido positivo nesse per√≠odo.

author: WFLX staff
title: Chuck E. Cheese brings back ‚ÄòSensory Sensitive Sundays‚Äô for kids with autism, special needs ‚Äì QC Life
text: Chuck E. Cheese marks Autism Awareness Month with the return of its program for children with autism and other sensory sensitivity needs. The family entertainment and dining venue announced it will bring back its ‚ÄúSensory Sensitive Sundays‚Äù program to participating locations nationwide on Sunday, April 11. The program creates dedicated playtime tailored for children with autism and other special sensory needs, offering a quieter dining and entertainment environment, dimmed lighting and a sensory-friendly arcade experience. Chuck E. Cheese locations that have reopened for games will open two hours early to host Sensory Sensitive Sunday events. The following locations in South Florida will participate in Sensory Sensitive Sunday on these dates: - BOCA RATON 21699 State Road 7, Boca Raton, FL 33428 - BOYNTON BEACH 244 N Congress Ave Bay 2A, Boynton Beach, FL 33425 - FORT LAUDERDALE ‚Äì SUNRISE 8099 W Oakland Park Blvd, Sunrise, FL 33311 - HIALEAH 3805 West 20th Avenue, Hialeah, FL 33012 - KENDALL 8701 S W 124th Avenue, Miami, FL 33183 - MIAMI ‚Äì NORTH ‚Äì 20335 Biscayne Blvd. L-1, Miami, FL 33180 - MIAMI ‚Äì SOUTH DADE 18575 South Dixie Hwy, Miami, FL 33157 - PEMBROKE PINES 8515 Pines Blvd, Pembroke Pines, FL 33024 - POMPANO BEACH 2201 N Federal Hwy #201, Pompano Beach, FL 33062 - STUART 2400 N.W. Federal Highway, Stuart, FL 34994 - WEST PALM BEACH 2471 Okeechobee Boulevard, West Palm Beach, FL 33409 See other participating locations [here](https://www.chuckecheese.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/SSS-STORELIST-r2.pdf). Select locations nationwide will reintroduce the program the first Sunday of every month for the remainder of 2021, according to a release. ‚ÄúFor many years, we‚Äôve hosted Sensory Sensitive Sundays to ensure that Chuck E. Cheese is truly the place where every kid can be a kid,‚Äù CEC Entertainment chief marketing officer Sherri Landry said in a release. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve heard from families that they appreciated the program and how much they‚Äôve missed it while it‚Äôs been paused during the pandemic. Bringing back Sensory Sensitive Sundays during Autism Awareness Month is a fitting way to celebrate and support these children and their families.‚Äù Chuck E. Cheese is also launching a month-long round-up campaign benefiting Autism Speaks, allowing guests to round up their purchases to the nearest dollar and support Autism Speaks‚Äô research and advocacy efforts. The CDC estimates that approximately 1 in 54 children in the U.S. are diagnosed with an autism spectrum disorder. ‚ÄúFinding ways to create spaces where autistic children feel safe, seen and heard is what makes Chuck E. Cheese the ultimate place where Every Kid Can be A Kid,‚Äù the company said. Chuck E. Cheese launched Sensory Sensitive Sundays for the first time in 2018. For more information on Chuck E. Cheese‚Äôs Sensory Sensitive Sundays and participating restaurants, visit the [website](https://www.chuckecheese.com/events/sensory-sensitive-sundays/). Copyright 2021 WFLX. All rights reserved.

author: @InvCourier
title: POWER CUTS LATEST: Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (SSEN) say all Highland customers should have the lights back on later today after mass power cuts caused by Storm Gerrit
text: POWER CUTS LATEST: Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (SSEN) say all Highland customers should have the lights back on later today after mass power cuts caused by Storm Gerrit Easier access to your trusted, local news. Subscribe to a digital package and support local news publishing. Engineers from Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (SSEN) hope to reconnect all remaining Highland customers hit by Storm Gerrit power cuts by later today. Teams from the power giant have been working through the night to tackle faults and breakages. By 11 am today, power had been restored to 47,000 homes and around 450 properties still off-grid. Gales, snow and heavy rain brought widespread damage to the grid infrastructure after storms hit on Wednesday. Localised faults remain in small pockets along the Great Glen, at Maryburgh, Achiltibuie and across Aberdeenshire and Perthshire. SSEN said these were ‚Äúthe sole focus‚Äù of today‚Äôs repair and restoration efforts, adding: ‚ÄúIt is expected all customers will be reconnected through the course of today and this evening, barring any unforeseen challenges.‚Äù Improving conditions yesterday saw substantial progress made in reconnecting thousands of people who had lost supplies, helped by the arrival of additional line crews from contractors and other network operators through Wednesday and Thursday. Teams continued to work into the early hours to clear debris, which was hindering access to areas where repairs were needed. That resulted in hundreds more properties being reconnected late last night. Since first light today, crews have resumed targeted efforts to restore those final properties. These include customers in the Fort Augustus area, as well as some in Maryburgh, Ross-shire. SSEN is continuing to work closely with local resilience partners to coordinate welfare arrangements and identify customers who may benefit from additional support. Customer service teams are also in regular contact with those on the Priority Services Register to give updates and offer support with alternative accommodation where necessary. In mobilising its response, SSEN dealt with over 13,000 incoming calls, while making more than 11,000 proactive calls to priority service register customers who might have needed extra assistance. Welfare vans serving free hot food and drink have also been deployed. Andy Smith, operations director at SSEN Distribution, said: ‚ÄúOur operational teams have made excellent progress in restoring customers impacted by Storm Gerrit, in the face of continued challenging conditions last night. ‚ÄúWe recognise this has been a difficult couple of days for the customers still affected, and I‚Äôm grateful to them for their continued patience and support as our teams work extremely hard to restore power. ‚ÄúUp to now we‚Äôve targeted our restoration plan on repairing the faults that will reconnect the greatest number of customers, and those who have been without power the longest. ‚ÄúToday, we face a number of complex and very localised faults, and we press on to reconnect those final customers affected. ‚ÄúWe are still encountering some access challenges. However, I‚Äôd like to reassure our customers that all our teams have been directed to these last few remaining areas of damage for this final push.‚Äù Anyone who may need additional help or advice should contact SSEN on the power cut helpline, 105.

author: Danielle
title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Says Her Daughters Swatted
text: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) said Thursday the houses of both her daughters were swatted. ‚ÄúBoth my daughter‚Äôs houses just got swatted today. Big thanks to the police who responded! We appreciate you and support you! Whoever is doing this, you are going to get caught and it won‚Äôt be funny to you anymore,‚Äù Greene said. Both my daughter‚Äôs houses just got swatted today. Big thanks to the police who responded! We appreciate you and support you! Whoever is doing this, you are going to get caught and it won‚Äôt be funny to you anymore. [@FBI] ‚Äî Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greeneüá∫üá∏ (@RepMTG) [December 28, 2023] [Greene](https://100percentfedup.com/marjorie-taylor-greene-swatted-on-christmas-day/) said her home was swatted for the 8th time on Christmas day. ‚ÄúI was just swatted. This is like the 8th time. On Christmas with my family here. My local police are the GREATEST and shouldn‚Äôt have to deal with this. I appreciate them so much and my family and I are in joyous spirits celebrating the birth of our savior Jesus Christ!‚Äù Greene commented. I was just swatted. This is like the 8th time. On Christmas with my family here. My local police are the GREATEST and shouldn‚Äôt have to deal with this. I appreciate them so much and my family and I are in joyous spirits celebrating the birth of our savior Jesus Christ! ‚Äî Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greeneüá∫üá∏ (@RepMTG) [December 25, 2023] ‚ÄúI was swatted this morning on Christmas Day and a few days ago ‚Äì Thursday Dec 21st. we received this death threat where this man is saying I will be shot in the head and skinned to make a ‚Äòparasol‚Äô making a reference to Gein, who was a psychopath killer who would make things out of his victim‚Äôs skin. He also says he would like to smash Pres Trump‚Äôs and Brian‚Äôs heads on a curb,‚Äù Greene later said. I was swatted this morning on Christmas Day and a few days ago ‚Äì Thursday Dec 21st. we received this death threat where this man is saying I will be shot in the head and skinned to make a ‚Äúparasol‚Äù making a reference to Gein, who was a psychopath killer who would make things out‚Ä¶ [pic.twitter.com/iW8JvOSJLa] ‚Äî Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greeneüá∫üá∏ (@RepMTG) [December 25, 2023] X users reacted to the news of Greene‚Äôs daughters being a swatting target: Swatting of conservatives will stop the moment when the FBI ceases being preoccupied with pursuing parents at school board meetings, Christians, pro-Lifers, and current regime political opponents and they will allocate their time and resources to finding those who abuse law‚Ä¶ [https://t.co/OiRiLXwNhX] ‚Äî I Meme Therefore I Am üá∫üá∏ (@ImMeme0) [December 28, 2023] This is so dangerous. Now they're going after her kids? [https://t.co/QAq37iK8xt] ‚Äî Wendy Patterson (@wendyp4545) [December 28, 2023] Why is the FBI continuing to allow this to happen to a member of the House of Representatives? Is it because she‚Äôs a Republican that Biden‚Äôs administration isn‚Äôt doing anything about these attempted murders on MTG and her family? Shame on you FBI. You stink! ‚Äî Paul A. Szypula üá∫üá∏ (@Bubblebathgirl) [December 28, 2023] [Forbes](https://www.forbes.com/sites/mollybohannon/2023/12/25/marjorie-taylor-greene-reports-swatting-at-her-house-on-christmas/?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=forbes&utm_term=se-breaking&sh=13d1fcacb8b5) reports: Greene has been swatted in the past, including at least twice in August 2022, and posted on X in October 2022 that she had been swatted for ‚Äúthe 6th time.‚Äù In that post, Greene called swatting ‚Äúa very serious crime (in which) the caller wants to have their victim murdered by police,‚Äù and said it is ‚Äúa giant abuse of police resources and time.‚Äù Swatting is rare, but it has occasionally resulted in death if police mount a large-scale response to a fake criminal call. Rep. [Brandon Williams](https://100percentfedup.com/another-gop-member-of-congress-swatted-on-christmas-day/) (R-NY) and Human Events Senior Editor [Jack Posobiec](https://100percentfedup.com/jack-posobiec-says-his-family-was-swatted-on-christmas-day/) have also been victims of recent swatting incidents.
